body.p:
Paintsville Ky,
December 21st 1865
To his Excelency Govr,
Thomas E. Bramlett
Frankfort Ky

Dear, Sir we the undersigned James, C, Castle -- Represent & showeth that, at this December Term 1865 of the Johnson Circuit Court -- a Judgment was Rendered against him for Tipling Selling Liquor to a Minor $50, the offence, happened ^If offence at all^ when there was no Law and order in the land And it was -- all that any man could Do, to make a Sustanance -- the acts Complained of was not resitance but necesity -- And an account of the Disturbed Condition of the County and the inability of the Citizens to Resume their ordinary asociations -- he Presents himself for Executive Clemency, upon these facts And statements of Commonwealth's atty. hereunto Presented --
We the undersigned Citizens Join in the above Petition and ask for Mr. Castles Executive-Intervention

Respectfully Yours --
James. E. Stewart Atty
John Hawes
Charles B Hawes
E H Conly
Ralph Staffard
Martin Preston
A. W. Nickell
Joseph

Johnson Cir Ct
vs
James C Castle
Petition Govr for For Remit
$50,
Remit
26th Dec/65
